perturbation.original_text:
ESCROW AGREEMENT:                                DATED:

Between:

(1)   [-1] whose registered office is at [-2] (CRN: [-3]) ("the Owner");

(2)   [-4] whose registered office is at [-5] (CRN: [-6]) ("the Licensee"); and

(3)   NCC ESCROW INTERNATIONAL LIMITED whose registered office is at Oxford       House, Oxford Road, Manchester M1 7ED, England (CRN:3081952) ("NCC").
perturbation.changed_text:
ESCROW AGREEMENT:                                DATED:

Between:

(1)   [-1] whose registered office is at [-2] (CRN: [-3]) ("the Depositor");

(2)   [-4] whose registered office is at [-5] (CRN: [-6]) ("the Recipient"); and

(3)   NCC ESCROW INTERNATIONAL LIMITED whose registered office is at Oxford       House, Oxford Road, Manchester M1 7ED, England (CRN:3081952) ("NCC").
perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'Owner' with 'Depositor' and 'Licensee' with 'Recipient.' Later sections still refer to 'Owner' and 'Licensee,' creating confusion about which terms apply.

In Section 2, I replaced 'Owner' with 'Supplier' and 'Licensee' with 'Client.' This creates ambiguity because the agreement also uses the original terms from the initial definition, making it unclear which entity holds the responsibilities.

perturbation.original_text:
6     Release Events

      6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a duly authorised officer of the Licensee if at any             time or times any of the following events or circumstances occur,             arise or become apparent:

            6.1.1 the Owner enters into any composition or arrangement with its                   creditors or (being a company) enters into liquidation whether                   compulsory or voluntary (other than for the purposes of                   solvent reconstruction or amalgamation) or has a receiver or                   administrative receiver appointed over all or any part of its                   assets or undertaking or a petition is presented for an                   Administration Order or (being an individual or partnership)                   becomes bankrupt, or an event occurs within the jurisdiction                   of the country in which the Owner is situated which has a                   similar effect to any of the above events in the United                   Kingdom; or
perturbation.changed_text:
6     Release Events

      6.1   Subject to the provisions of Clauses 6.2 and 6.3, NCC shall release             the Material to a duly authorised officer of the Client if at any             time or times any of the following events or circumstances occur,             arise or become apparent:

            6.1.1 the Depositor enters into any composition or arrangement with its                   creditors or (being a company) enters into liquidation whether                   compulsory or voluntary (other than for the purposes of                   solvent reconstruction or amalgamation) or has a receiver or                   administrative receiver appointed over all or any part of its                   assets or undertaking or a petition is presented for an                   Administration Order or (being an individual or partnership)                   becomes bankrupt, or an event occurs within the jurisdiction                   of the country in which the Depositor is situated which has a                   similar effect to any of the above events in the United                   Kingdom; or
perturbation.explanation: In Section 6, 'Licensee' is replaced with 'Client' and 'Owner' with 'Depositor'. This section outlines the conditions for releasing the escrowed material. Since the entire document doesn't consistently use these replacements, it leads to confusion about who is entitled to what under what circumstances, undermining the legal certainty of the contract.
